page.title: 03TOURIST ATTRACTIONS
page.content: This area is a fine tourist attraction.It is a delight to walkers and rich in its varied wild life both flora and fauna.The seashore and the saltmarsh are a paradise for birdwatchers with waders and teals amongst the many seabirds that can be seen.Swallow Cliff Bay is an ideal site for geologists. From the caravan park at the bottom of Sand Point is a lovely walk to Woodspring Priory. Take the path which goes in a North Easterly direction from the car park and one can reach Middle Hope Bay which is an excellent picnic spot and an interesting beach for children amongst others to explore.
